weeklyTopNews.title: Victoria's coronavirus case numbers keep falling, as Daniel Andrews flags state of emergency extension
weeklyTopNews.summary: Victoria's case numbers dropped sharply with only 116 announced today. This is the lowest daily tally since July 5th, when 74 cases were announced. July 5th was also the last time the number of new cases announced was under a hundred. Victorian Premier Daniel Andrews also announced today that the government is looking at extending the the state of emergency provisions that allowed for the coronavirus restrictions for 12 more months.

weeklyTopNews.title: Funding for Victorian bushfire-affected communities as premier warns upcoming summer will be a challenge
weeklyTopNews.summary: The state government has announced more than $110 million for bushfire-affected communities to help their long-term economic recovery. State Premier Daniel Andrews expressed that the state will be ready to handle the upcoming bushfire season, but stressed that it would not be easy.

weeklyTopNews.title: New coronavirus restrictions return in Queensland as youth detention centre cluster grows
weeklyTopNews.summary: Six more cases of COVID-19 have been reported in Queenslands. All six belong to a cluster at a youth detention centre. Authorities have now moved to limit indoor and outdoor gatherings.

weeklyTopNews.title: More than 18,000 Australians stranded by coronavirus are still trying to return home
weeklyTopNews.summary: The Department of Foreign Affairs and Trade have revealed that 18,800 Australians remain overseas and have had their returns delayed due to the country's cap on internation arrivals. DFAT officials warned the pariliaments COVID committee of the situation earlier today.

weeklyTopNews.title: Coronavirus health alert issued for Brisbane cafe after woman tests positive
weeklyTopNews.summary: A women testing positive for COVID-19 in Japan has prompted urgent contact tracing and coronavirus testing in Brisbane. The woman had flown to Sydney on 17th August and subsequently flew to Jpan where she tested positive for COVID-19.
